result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Sean Forneste

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Sean Forneste appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Michael Sean Forneste.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Michael Sean Forneste not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Michael Sean Forneste.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing remains scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Court set a bail/bond hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of date.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.

Defendant Michael Sean Forneste not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Findling is in a motion hearing in another court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant.  (Michael S. Forneste - #2022009137, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Jason A Findling in court via video, defendant Michael Sean Forneste not in court, in custody at HOC.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Case adjourned due to the defendant being in the Covid Pod with limited video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with APB and EAB.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Michael Sean Forneste in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Michael Sean Forneste in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Sean Forneste appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
